end-of-life: Does last version not run on OS
last working version: Last known version to support OS. If end-of-life is not reached yet, optionally contains the last known version that runs (also see best version)
last why: Reference to why some version is last to support OS
best why: Why the "best" version is better than last version

comments: If use modern OSs, be sure to run in XP compatibility mode for more stable work

best why: Much faster performance, lot less bloat while supporting all implementations of PDF
One of the most stable versions
One of the last bloatless versions

comments: Better performance than FF. Most of websites displayed correctly (2018)

best why: One of the last bloatless versions

comments: Last version is publicly exploitable, dont use unless you know the risks
More recent and stable than Chrome. All websites are displayed correctly (2018)
Has 99.9% of what modern Git has (2018). More recent than TortoiseGit
Stable & all functionality present. Latter versions cannot be installed correctly
Latter versions do install but don't run
Other forks/implementations of Python may still support XP

best why: Last version before online activation needed

comments: Versions starting from 1.14.3.0 are not compatible with Windows XP anymore.
